issue.title: PBS Android TV App Video Playback

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.8

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

pbs.org

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

AdGuard DNS filter

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

When having AdGuard for Android TV (v4.8) running with the basic ad blocking, tracker blocker, and AdGuard default DNS protection enabled (and no custom user rules active) the PBS Android TV app is unable to play videos due to the pre-video advertisement being blocked not allowing the video the play. If I disable protection for the PBS app within AdGuard's settings, video playback works as expected.




### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
I tested this by turning off either the adblocking protection or dns protection (AdGuard DNS default) and the video ad now comes and goes either way. Occasionally the ad will try to play which prevents video playback entirely, other times the ad doesn’t play at all and the app operates as expected. 

Just to clarify, this is happening with the AdGuard for Android TV app on a Chromecast with Google TV running Android TV 14. I’m not sure if there is a way to export logs or not on that platform/device.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/194856

pull_request.title: Block ad script on Gelbooru
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?
This filters out the popunder code that is contained in an inline script on Gelbooru. Though blocking pemsrv.com prevents Gelbooru from opening an actual advertisement for a popunder, it creates another tab containing the page you're currently in, which is an annoying advertisement leftover.

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?
I don't know if there is any, I just noticed this today. This explains the issue well enough.

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
@Alex-302 
We’ve received reports from our clients and their users indicating that domains associated with our service, particularly [sdk-v2.conscent.in](http://sdk-v2.conscent.in/), are being blocked by AdGuard.

This subdomain is part of our platform, Conscent.in, which provides subscription infrastructure and paywall solutions for digital publishers. The SDK is used solely to enable secure and seamless access to premium content, and does not engage in ad tracking or any behavior that might warrant filtering.

Could you please confirm if [sdk-v2.conscent.in](http://sdk-v2.conscent.in/) is currently on any AdGuard blocklists?

If so, we’d appreciate your help in understanding the reason, and if there are specific guidelines or steps we need to follow to have it reviewed and potentially removed. We’re happy to make any necessary adjustments or provide clarification on our use case.

pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [x] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

[https://blog.skillfactory.ru/glossary/deploy/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.skillfactory.ru%2Fglossary%2Fdeploy%2F)

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Your comment

Остатки от кнопок поделиться

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/86c6083c-4886-4127-bd9c-212ba84eee75)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/194856

comment.body:
> Other extensions used:	uBlock Origin uBlock Origin Lite

Do not stack up content blockers, it's seriously a bad idea. I suspect you have other extensions too, disable ALL extensions except for AdGuard and test again.

> I have also tried to disable complete sections from the app, one at a time, it did not work.

If you meant the app modules, that's strange. So, you have disabled all modules, but with global protection enabled, the problem remains?

> It's not bitdefender

Have you checked it with only AdGuard app? If there's another case, please write steps to reproduce in detail, as this is still not reproduced with the above configuration.

pull_request.title: Fix kpopping.com
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://kpopping.com/profiles/group/GOT-the-beat

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Your comment

Ad leftovers in desktop apps

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d1f10f12-8430-401b-8c0f-1c4be1534c59)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

Not reproduced on my end.
Try to leave only AdGuard filters, update them (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

comment.body:
> > I have also tried to disable complete sections from the app, one at a time, it did not work.
> 
> If you meant the app modules, that's strange. So, you have disabled all modules, but with global protection enabled, the problem remains?
> 
> > It's not bitdefender
> 
> Have you checked it with only AdGuard app? If there's another case, please write steps to reproduce in detail, as this is still not reproduced with the above configuration.

Well, you were right. It appears to be Bitdefender. I disabled all Bitdefender's modules and the logs from any github workflow run started working. 
I will dig now deeper into Bitdefender to understand what doesn't allow me to use the pages. 

I appreciate your time on this! Thank you!

Это правило блочит ссылки на группы в соцсетях в футере.
Лучше так: `blog.skillfactory.ru##.block__history-info > div.socials:has(> a[href^="https://t.me/share/"])`

issue.title: Bilibili uses IP to bypass ad filtering rules
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.9

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://dl.hdslb.com/mobile/latest/android64/iBiliPlayer-bili.apk?t=20250323

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### Privacy

AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

AdGuard DNS filter

### Language-specific

AdGuard Chinese filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

如图所示，url中hosts后面的域名是广告域名，被你们的移动广告过滤器拦截了，但是哔哩哔哩通过IP绕过规则，所以我就使用  `||*/resolve?host=*bili*&query=*$app=tv.danmaku.bili`   来拦截。建议使用我提供的这条规则，这样可以保证规则只用在哔哩哔哩这个软件上，不影响其它软件

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/01da8b09-bbd0-446f-971f-b7b7e3761c4b)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fe7ecb2c-1956-42ea-a490-d367ae5cfe15)

### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: www.logicool.co.jp

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.logicool.co.jp/ja-jp/shop](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.logicool.co.jp%2Fja-jp%2Fshop) ### Comment > Blank page issue > Also occurs on English website https://www.logitech.com/en-us > > I've found out that this is because the rules `||webtags.logitech.com^` in AdGuard's Tracking Protection filter and `||cookielaw.org^$third-party` in Annoyances filter block some `script` and `link` elements. > > Adding > ``` > @@||webtags.logitech.com^$script,stylesheet,domain=logicool.co.jp|logitech.com > @@||cookielaw.org^$script,third-party,domain=logicool.co.jp|logitech.com > ``` > works fine, but I'm not sure if these rules weaken tracking protection. > > Note that the same rule `||webtags.logitech.com^` in AdGuard's DNS filter should be retained > (DNS blocking has nothing to do with this case) ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/de3i36vnvbk8g8sg8c0g444kwks0ww0me3mzzs9ce8.png?nc=1)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.logicool.co.jp/ja-jp/shop](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.logicool.co.jp%2Fja-jp%2Fshop) ### Comment > Blank page issue > Also occurs on English website https://www.logitech.com/en-us > > I've found out that this is because the rules `||webtags.logitech.com^` in AdGuard's Tracking Protection filter and `||cookielaw.org^$third-party` in Annoyances filter block some `script` and `link` elements. > > Adding > ``` > @@||webtags.logitech.com^$script,stylesheet,domain=logicool.co.jp|logitech.com > @@||cookielaw.org^$script,third-party,domain=logicool.co.jp|logitech.com > ``` > works fine, but I'm not sure if these rules weaken tracking protection. > > Note that the same rule `||webtags.logitech.com^` in AdGuard's DNS filter should be retained > (DNS blocking has nothing to do with this case) ### Screenshots

pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

issue.title: Bilibili uses IP to bypass ad filtering rules
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.9

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://dl.hdslb.com/mobile/latest/android64/iBiliPlayer-bili.apk?t=20250323

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### Privacy

AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

AdGuard DNS filter

### Language-specific

AdGuard Chinese filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

如图所示，url中hosts后面的域名是广告域名，被你们的移动广告过滤器拦截了，但是哔哩哔哩通过IP绕过规则，所以我就使用  `||*/resolve?host=*bili*&query=*$app=tv.danmaku.bili`   来拦截。建议使用我提供的这条规则，这样可以保证规则只用在哔哩哔哩这个软件上，不影响其它软件

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/01da8b09-bbd0-446f-971f-b7b7e3761c4b)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fe7ecb2c-1956-42ea-a490-d367ae5cfe15)

### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
> 它就像 DNS over HTTP~S~。/resolve？host= 未加载任何内容

这不像是DOH。很明显没有使用https，而是http。而且我在日志中发现了这个软件的dns-over-https的域名

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.5.10

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2025/03/how-google-nerfed-my-pixel-4a-then-stuck-it-to-me-too/

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter

### Security

Online Malicious URL Blocklist

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. arstechnica.com has started including auto-playing videos within their articles on mobile and desktop. The link above brings you to a specific example, but it is relevant to all website articles. While the auto-playing video is not an advertisement, it is also not relevant in anyway to article contents. I suggest blocking these under the "AdGuard Annoyances" filter as these autoplaying videos are distracting and manually blocking them does not create any site blockage in my experience.

Blocking arstechnica.com##.cne-interlude-container should block this annoyance from displaying.

issue.title: Bilibili uses IP to bypass ad filtering rules
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.9

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://dl.hdslb.com/mobile/latest/android64/iBiliPlayer-bili.apk?t=20250323

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### Privacy

AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

AdGuard DNS filter

### Language-specific

AdGuard Chinese filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

如图所示，url中hosts后面的域名是广告域名，被你们的移动广告过滤器拦截了，但是哔哩哔哩通过IP绕过规则，所以我就使用  `||*/resolve?host=*bili*&query=*$app=tv.danmaku.bili`   来拦截。建议使用我提供的这条规则，这样可以保证规则只用在哔哩哔哩这个软件上，不影响其它软件

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/01da8b09-bbd0-446f-971f-b7b7e3761c4b)

comment.body:
> [@soraneoumi](https://github.com/soraneoumi) Can't reproduce. Same question as ⬆

Thank you for updating.
After I updated this issue, I did a more detailed test, on AdGuard for windows and AdGuard for Mac, turning off ad filtering and turning off extensions did not improve it, except that it disappeared after completely turn off the Adguard program.
I have now switched to the Firefox browser plugin for Adguard and this phenomenon cannot be reproduced. I think this may be due to something deeper than the filtering rules.

comment.body:
> 它似乎已被感染或网络钓鱼 - 大量混淆脚本，并在几秒钟后重定向到其他站点。

Hello, is it because the ads on this site are too difficult to handle, so you just close it? This site is not infected or phishing, it is just a simple fiction site, and then the ads in it are to direct visitors to other websites in order to get income, so they keep jumping. After I banned all JavaScript, I still couldn't solve the problem, so I reported it to you

issue.title: Altibox.no - Broken functions (AdGuard Annoyances filter) [GDPR]
issue.body:
### Affected site:
`https://www.altibox.no/`

### Issue:
Various functions, like confirming your TV and/or internet subscription contents, doesn't work, due to a blocked cookie consent, which needs to be accepted!

(To reproduce, you need to be logged in to an account)

### Blocked assets:
```
https://policy.app.cookieinformation.com/*/altibox.no/*.js
https://policy.app.cookieinformation.com/uc.js
```

### Problem filter:
* **AdGuard Annoyances filter**

### Problem rule:
`||policy*.cookieinformation.com^$third-party`

### Possible fix:
`@@||policy.app.cookieinformation.com^$script,domain=altibox.no`

### Other problem filters:
* **Easylist Cookie List** / **Fanboy's Annoyance List** ( https://github.com/easylist/easylist/issues/7805/ )
`###coiOverlay[role="banner"][style*="flex"]`
`||cookieinformation.com/*/*.js`

* ~~**I don't care about cookies** _(NOTIFIED)_~~ _(FIXED)_
~~`policy.app.cookieinformation.com$domain=~kartor.eniro.se|~kart.gulesider.no|~kort.degulesider.dk|~map.krak.dk|~babysam.dk|~minaftale.dk`~~

--

### System info:
* OS/version: Windows 8.1 Pro (x64)
* Browser/version: Pale Moon v29.2.0 (x64)
* Adblock Extension/version: uBlock Origin v1.16.4.28 (XUL)

Попробуйте проверить обновления фильтров, возможно, проблема уже решена. Если вы все еще можете воспроизвести проблему, откройте ее снова здесь. Мы будем признательны, если вы предоставите дополнительную информацию или скриншоты.

comment.body:
> App is unsafe according to Google Protect.
> Do you see any ads?

This app is safe and is a very popular short video app in China. It's similar to TikTok. In China, this software has a similar market share to the Chinese version of TikTok. In China, Kuaishou is not inferior to the Chinese version of TikTok（douyin）.So don't worry about this software being insecure.

From this domain name, it can be seen that this is actually a tracker for collecting logs. The domain name has been added to other ad rule lists. Including the list of advertising rules specifically for China (Anti-AD), which has banned this domain name.
